'''Pascal Groß''' ({{IPA-de|pasˈkaːl ˈɡʁoːs}}, sometimes rendered in English as '''Gross'''; born 15 June 1991) is a German professional [[association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[midfielder]] for [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]]. Groß is a youth international for Germany.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://datencenter.dfb.de/profil/151555/spiele_in_wettbewerb/1355/31271#c1355_t31271|title=Pascal Groß Personenprofil :: DFB – Deutscher Fußball-Bund e.V.|website=datencenter.dfb.de}}</ref>
==Career== ===Early career=== Groß played his first fully professional match in the [[Bundesliga]] for [[TSG 1899 Hoffenheim|1899 Hoffenheim]] on 2 May 2009 in a 0–4 loss against [[VfL Wolfsburg]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/spieltag/spielpaarungsbericht/object/863684|title=13-Minuten-Hattrick von Dzeko|work=kicker.de|date=2 May 2009|accessdate=3 May 2009}}</ref> being substituted on in the 89th minute for [[Chinedu Obasi]]. In January 2011, he transferred to [[Karlsruher SC]] along with Hoffenheim teammate [[Marco Terrazzino]].<ref name="KSC">{{cite web|title=KSC verpflichtet zwei U20-Nationalspieler: Terrazzino und Groß wechseln in den Wildpark|trans-title=KSC signs two U20 Internationals: Terrazzino and Groß are transferring to the Wildpark|language=German|date=28 January 2011|accessdate=28 January 2011|publisher=[[Karlsruher SC]]|work=official website|url=http://www.ksc.de/aktuelles/anzeigen/news/ksc-verpflichtet-zwei-u20-nationalspieler-terrazzino-und-gross-wechseln-in-den-wildpark.html|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110131080343/http://www.ksc.de/aktuelles/anzeigen/news/ksc-verpflichtet-zwei-u20-nationalspieler-terrazzino-und-gross-wechseln-in-den-wildpark.html|archivedate=31 January 2011|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
===Ingolstadt=== Groß scored five league goals for [[FC Ingolstadt]] in the 2016–17 season as they were relegated from the Bundesliga. He created more chances than any other player in the league that season, a total of 95 chances.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.goal.com/en-gb/amp/news/brighton-pascal-gross-first-premier-league-signing-chris-hughton-/1u4yjm9p946n6zf8nwo2aq68k|title=Brighton sign Pascal Groß|publisher=Goal.com|accessdate=9 September 2017}}</ref>
{{Expand section|date=November 2017}}
===Brighton & Hove Albion=== In May 2017, [[Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton & Hove Albion]] signed Groß for a fee of £3 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=Pascal Gross: Brighton & Hove Albion sign FC Ingolstadt 04 midfielder|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/39980263|accessdate=19 May 2017|work=BBC Sport|date=19 May 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://uk.reuters.com/article/uk-soccer-england-brh-new-gross/brightons-under-the-radar-signing-gross-proving-his-worth-idUKKCN1BX2RV |title=Brighton's under the radar signing Gross proving his worth|first=Pete|last= Hall|date=22 September 2017|work=Reuters }}</ref> He agreed to a four-year contract while the transfer fee paid to Ingolstadt was the first of a series of record signings for the club that season.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sportbible.com/football/transfers-brighton-have-broken-their-transfer-record-yet-again-20170807 |title=Brighton Have Broken Their Transfer Record Yet Again|first=Josh |last=Lawless |work=Sport Bible |date=7 August 2017}}</ref>
He made his debut for Brighton in the [[Premier League]] on 12 August 2017, in a 2–0 home defeat to title favourites [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/40835422|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 0–2 Manchester City|publisher=BBC Sport|date=12 August 2017}}</ref> On 9 September 2017, Groß made history by scoring Brighton's first ever Premier League goal, adding a second shortly after half time and providing an assist for [[Tomer Hemed]] in a 3–1 win at home against [[West Bromwich Albion F.C.|West Bromwich Albion]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Premier League ruft! Gross verlässt FCI|url=http://www.kicker.de/news/fussball/bundesliga/startseite/678459/artikel_premier-league-ruft-gross-verlaesst-fci.html|accessdate=19 May 2017|work=kicker Online|date=19 May 2017|language=German}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 3–1 West Bromwich Albion|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41133349|accessdate=10 September 2017|work= BBC Sport|date=9 September 2017}}</ref> On 15 September, in Brighton's 2–1 league defeat away to [[AFC Bournemouth]], Groß provided the assist for [[Solly March]]'s opening goal.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41196761|title=AFC Bournemouth 2–1 Brighton & Hove Albion|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 September 2017}}</ref>
Groß's creative exploits for Brighton throughout the month of September earned him a nomination for the [[Premier League]] Player of the Month award. He was a key player for Brighton, being directly involved in four of their league goals scored throughout the month.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/15582380.Let_s_be_more_confident__award_contender_Gross_urges_Albion/|title=Premier League player of the month contender Pascal Gross urges Brighton and Hove Albion to be more confident|publisher=The Argus|date=7 October 2017}}</ref>
On 15 October 2017, Groß provided his third assist of the season for Brighton, setting up [[Anthony Knockaert]] in a 1–1 league draw at home to [[Everton F.C.|Everton]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://m.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41541146|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–1 Everton|publisher=BBC Sport|date=15 October 2017}}</ref> On 20 November, Groß scored for Brighton in a 2–2 home draw against [[Stoke City F.C.|Stoke City]]. The goal brought his contribution tally up to three goals and five assists throughout the course of the season.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/41964596|title=Brighton 2–2 Stoke|publisher=BBC Sport|date=20 November 2017}}</ref>
Groß ended a successful season for Brighton with seven goals and eight assists, including heading the winner against Manchester United on 4 May 2018.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/43916611|title=Brighton & Hove Albion 1–0 Manchester United|date=2018-05-04|work=BBC Sport|access-date=2018-05-17|language=en-GB}}</ref> Amongst many highlights, Groß was voted Brighton's player of the season by an overwhelming majority.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.theargus.co.uk/sport/16171462.Bargain_buy_Gross_named_Albion_s_Player_of_the_Season/|title=Bargain buy Gross named Albion's Player of the Season|website=The Argus|language=en|access-date=2018-05-17}}</ref>
On 6 June 2018, Groß signed a contract extension with Brighton, keeping him at the club until 2022.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.brightonandhovealbion.com/news/2018/june/new-deal-for-midfielder/|title=New deal for midfielder|publisher=Brighton & Hove Albion F.C.|date=6 June 2018|accessdate=7 June 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== His father, [[Stephan Groß|Stephan]], was also a footballer who played for [[Karlsruher SC]].<ref name="KSC"/>
